page.title: 18COLYTON IN WORLD WAR 2
page.content: In 1945 Colyton was a small village,mainly surrounded by pasture land.There were about 5 general stores,a bank and a doctor, who operated in Colyford as well. During the war,lots of young men from Colyton went away to fight. Those who didn't go formed a big Home Guard in case of attack. Colyton was bombed only once,this was done when quite a few Incendary bombs were dropped on the Station House.They caught fire to hay bales and lit up the whole valley. On V.E.Day they lit a huge fire outside the Colcombe Castle,to celebrate,but men had to watch it all night because there were oil tanks over the road.They lit this to welcombe their boys home.
